column4: Is the only differences the number of languague translations or?
Ubuntu is Debian tuned for the desktop with the latest versions of things.
But I have heard that the new Linux Debian 3.1 is also good to desktop
Well, 3.1 has XFree86 4.3 and GNOME 2.8. Ubuntu's latest release has Xorg 6.8 and GNOME 2.10
Is Xorg better than the normal X? - or something..?
Xorg is a fork of XFree86, XFree86 is dead
You put in a CD, choose a couple of simple language and partition choices, wait 20 minutes, and you have a gdm login screen that takes you to a full GNOME desktop that Just Works (most of the time).
But that is the same thing you do with Linux Debian 3.1?..
Appearently hoary pretty much has every package sarge has plus more.
Do not mix Debian and Ubuntu repositories.
Iam not the best to english...What does "repositories" means?
Oh, okay.. But for example the IRC server "asuka" and IRC bouncer "psybnc" I need to compile - are there the correct libraries and compilers in Ubuntu?
If they're in Debian they're in Ubuntu.
